results.title: The Terence Davies trilogy: children: Madonna and child: death and transfiguration
results.creator_credit: Terence Davies, British Film Institute and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description: Davies found the form in his partly autobiographical trilogy to transform Liverpudlian Robert Tucker’s development - from victimised schoolboy, in ‘Children’ (1976) through a Catholic repressed gay middle age ‘Madonna and Child’ (1980), to senility and death in hospital ‘Death and Transfiguration’ (1983) - into a rich, resonant tapestry of impressionistic detail. The bleakness is relieved by a wry wit, imaginative use of music and flashes of surrealism foreshadowing Davies’ subsequent autobiographies “Distant Voices, Still Lives” and “The Long Day Closes”. The trilogy is finally a spiritual work anchored firmly in the flux of everyday experience. Cast includes: ‘Children’; Phillip Maudsely (young Robert), Nick Stringer and Robin Hooper (Robert aged 23): ‘Madonna and child’; Terry O’Sullivan (Robert) and Sheila Raynor: ‘Death and transfiguration’; Wilfred Brambell (elderly Robert), Terry O’Sullivan (middle aged Robert), and Iain Munro.

results.title: The Madigan Line
results.brief_description: One of the most inhospitable and desolate regions on Earth, the Simpson Desert was to fight off many challenges to penetrate its seemingly impenetrable heart. Expedition after expedition tried and failed. Men died but still they came. This video faithfully reenacts the 1939 expedition of Dr. Cecil Madigan who successfully crossed Australias last frontier.

results.title: The Joy Luck Club
results.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Amy Tan, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, “The Joy Luck Club” tells the story of two generations of Chinese women. Four are mothers and wives who emigrated from China to build new lives and families in the United States. The other four are their Chinese-American daughters who are struggling to define their own identities against the expectations of their mothers and the American society where they live. Wayne Wang masterfully interweaves the stories of the eight women which spans from feudal China to modern America, highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations. “The Joy Luck Club” is a beautiful film to watch, with lavish production values which make the characters’ stories even more compelling.

results.title: Set no limits: Sydney 2000 Paralympic Games
results.brief_description: Australian Paralympians don’t often receive as much publicity as their non paralympic counterparts. This video attempts to even out the balance by providing highlights and victories from previous Paralympic Games, which began in 1960. Highlighted on the video is Lizzie (as in lizard), mascot of the Paralympic Games who symbolises the dreams and motivation of the competitors. This section is narrated by Olivia Newton-John. Suitable for primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Tripwire
results.creator_credit: Valerie Morton, David Hirst and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: A character and action driven true-life adventure documentary looking at the Australian Armys secret Norforce unit that forms this Island continents first line of defence across the remote Kimberly region and the Northern Territory. Norforce is also one of the msot dynamic experiments in inter-racial relations as the unit is made up of both white and Aboriginal Australians where the soldiers learn essential survival skills from each other. Narrated by Archie Roach, and featuring the music of the Warumpi Band.

results.title: Lola BRD 3
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder, Horst Wendlandt, Rialto Film, Tri Films and Westdeutscher Rundfunk
results.brief_description: The full title of Lola as it appears on the screen is “Lola BRD 3” (Bundesrepublik Deutschland 3), which identifies the film as the third of the trilogy begun by “The Marriage of Maria Braun” and then “Veronika Voss”. This variation on Josef von Sternberg’s “The Blue Angel”, set in Bavaria of the 1950s, tells the story of a nightclub hostess who seduces a pillar of the local community. However this is more than simply an expose of small-town hypocrisy and double standards: Fassbinder makes it abundantly clear that his target is the moral shabbiness of the Adenauer period as a whole, and ruthlessly lays bare the dubious foundations of the entire, much vaunted, ‘German economic miracle’. His bizarrely ironic visual style, with its highly formalised colour schemes and curious transitions has to be seen to be believed. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Martha
results.creator_credit: Rainer Werner Fassbinder and Peter Marthesheimer
results.brief_description: After Martha Heyer’s tyrannical father dies suddenly during their holiday in Italy, she meets and is proposed to by engineer Helmut Salomon, who sweeps her off her feet with a disturbing mixture of romance and intimidation. After their marriage Helmut’s behaviour becomes increasingly oppressive and Martha’s ever more fearful and desperate to please, as the film builds to a truly horrific climax. Whether taken as a psychological horror movie or as the blackest of black comedies, this is undoubtedly the most extreme and alarming of all of Fassbinder’s visions of married life. In German with English subtitles.

results.title: Orphee
results.creator_credit: Jean Cocteau, Andre Paulve and Les Films du Palais Royal
results.brief_description: Cocteau’s updating of the Orpheus legend which haunted his own life takes the poet (Jean Marais), from contemporary Paris to a mysterious chateau ruled by an imperious Princess (Maria Casares), who first claims a younger poet, then Orpheus’ wife, Eurydice. With its unforgettable imagery of leather-clad motorcyclists, the eerie ruins of the Zone and messages from another world received by car radio, this has had a profound influence on both Hollywood and the avant-garde. Cast also includes Francois Perier, Juliette Greco. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Neverending story 2: the next chapter
results.creator_credit: George Miller, Dieter Geissler and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Bastian (Jonathan Brandis), the reluctant hero of “The Neverending story” is unhappy away from Fantasia. His dad seems to have forgotten about his deceased mother and is dating someone Bastian doesn’t like, and Bastian didn’t make the swim team because he was afraid of heights and couldn’t jump off the diving board. He is drawn back to Fantasia to the friends he made; the Childlike Empress, Atreyu, Falkor, and Rock Biter. There are also fantastic new creatures to meet like Mudwart, Lavaman, Windbride, Instrument Spinster, Tri-Face, the Wamboes and Nimbly. There is a job to be done in Fanstasia however, as the sorceress Xayide and Smerg the evil dragon have unscrupulous plans for Fantasia. It’s up to Bastian and his friends to once again save Fantasia and prevent a disaster. Also starring Alexandra Johnes, Kenny Morrison, Clarissa Burt and John Wesley Shipp. This video also features a cartoon preview, “Box office bunny”, the first Bugs Bunny theatrical cartoon in 26 years.

results.title: Man on the moon: Apollo 11 [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and National Aeronautics and Space Administration
results.brief_description: Shows the details of the lunar surface from official footage recorded by the Apollo 11 spacecrew during the first manned moon landing on 20th July, 1969. Part of the 2 million feet of film made Public Domain by NASA. Silent film with English subtitles.
